column2: (reading the program) Ooh! Look! Look! Look! Look, there's Joey's\npicture! This is so exciting!"
You can always spot someone who's never seen one of his plays before.\nNotice, no fear, no sense of impending doom..."
The exclamation point in the title scares me. (Gesturing) Y'know, it's\nnot just Freud, it's Freud!"
Oh, shhh, shh. Magic is about to happen.'
Vell, Eva, ve've done some excellent vork here, and I vould have to say,\nyour pwoblem is qviiite clear. (He goes into a song and dance number.) "
God. I feel violated.'
Did anybody else feel they just wanted to peel the skin off their body,\nto have something else to do?'
(staring at a woman across the room) Ross, ten o'clock."
Is it? Feels like two.'
No, ten o'clock."
What?'
(sighs and gestures to explain) There's a beautiful woman at eight,\nnine, ten o'clock!"
Oh. Hel-lo!'
She's amazing! She makes the women that I dream about look like short,\nfat, bald men!"
Well, go over to her! She's not with anyone."
Oh yeah, and what would my opening line be? 'Excuse me.\nBlarrglarrghh.'"
Oh, c'mon. She's a person, you can do it!"
Oh please, could she be more out of my league? Ross,\nback me up here.'
He could never get a woman like that in a million years.'
Thank you, buddy.'
Oh, oh, but y'know, you always see these really beautiful women with\nthese really nothing guys, you could be one of those guys."
You could do that!'
Y'think?"
Yeah!'
Oh God, I can't believe I'm even considering this... I'm very very\naware of my tongue..."
C'mon! C'mon!"
Here goes. (He walks over to her but just stands there.)'
Hi.... um... okay, next word... would be... Chandler! Chandler is my\nname, and, uh...(He clears his throat noisily)...hi.'
Yes, you said that.'

Yes, yes I did, but what I didn't say was what I was about to say,\nwhat I wanted to say was, uh... would you like to go out with me sometime, thankyou,\ngoodnight. (He walks back to the others but she calls him back.) "
Chandler?'
Hey! You're in a play! I didn't know you could dance! You had a beard!"
Whadja think?'
...Hey! You're in a play! I didn't know you could dance! You had a beard!"
C'mon, you guys, it wasn't that bad. It was better than that thing I did\nwith the trolls, at least you got to see my head."
(admitting) Saw your head. Saw your head.'

(running back) She said yes!! She said yes!! (To Joey) Awful play,
man. Whoah. (To All) Her name's Aurora, and she's Italian, and she pronounces my name
'Chand-lrr'. 'Chand-lrr'. I think I like it better that way. (To Joey) Oh, listen, the
usher gave me this to give to you. (He fishes a card out of his pocket.)"
What is it?'
The Estelle Leonard Talent Agency. Wow, an agency left me its card! Maybe\nthey wanna sign me!'
Based on this play? ...Based on this play!'
Hey, kids. '
Hey.'
(reading Monica's palm) No, 'cause this line is passion, and this is...\njust a line."
Well, I can't believe I've been here almost seven seconds and you\nhaven't asked me how my date went."
Oh, right, right. How was your date, 'Chand-lrr'?"
It was unbelievable. I-I've never met anyone like her. She's had the\nmost amazing life! She was in the Israeli army..."

...Luckily none of the bullets hit the engine block. So, we made it\nto the border, but just barely, and I- ...I've been talking about myself all night long,\nI'm sorry. What about you? Tell me one of your stories."
Alright. Once I got on the subway, right, and it was at night, and I\nrode it all the way to Brooklyn... just for the hell of it.'
We talked 'til like two. It was this perfect evening... more or\nless."
...All of a sudden we realised we were in Yammon. '
Oh, I'm sorry, so 'we' is?"
'We' would be me and Rick."
Who's Rick?"
Who's Rick?"
My husband.'
Ooooohhh.'
Oh, so you're divorced?"
No.'
Oh, I'm sorry, then you're widowed?...Hopefully?"
No, I'm still married."
So tell me, how do- how do you think your husband would feel about you\nsitting here with me?...Sliding your foot so far up my pant leg you can count the change\nin my pocket?'
Don't worry. I imagine he'd be okay with you because really, he's okay\nwith Ethan."
Ethan? There's, there's an Ethan?"
Mmmm... Ethan is my... boyfriend.'
What?!'
So explain something to me here, uh, what kind of a relationship do\nyou imagine us having if you already have a husband and a boyfriend?'
I suppose mainly sexual.'
Oh. I'm sorry it didn't work out."
What 'not work out'? I'm seeing her again on Thursday. Didn't you\nlisten to the story?"
Didn't you listen to the story? I mean, this is twisted! How could you\nget involved with a woman like this?"
Well, y'know, I had some trouble with it at first too, but the way I\nlook at it is, I get all the good stuff
Oh, yeah. That is not true. Ross, is this your fantasy?'
No, of course not! (Thinks) ...Yeah, yeah, it is.'
What? So you guys don't mind going out with someone else who's going out\nwith someone else?"
I couldn't do it."
Good for you, Joey.'
When I'm with a woman, I need to know that I'm going out with\nmore people than she is."
Well, y'know, monogamy can be a, uh, tricky concept. I mean,\nanthropologically speaking-"
Fine. Fine, alright, now you'll never know."
We're kidding. C'mon, tell us!"
Yeah! C'mon!"
Alright. There's a theory, put forth by Richard Leakey-"
Tah-daaah!'
Are we greeting each other this way now? 'Cause I like that."
Look! I cleaned! I did the windows, I did the floors... I even used all\nthe attachments on the vacuum, except that little round one with the bristles, I don't\nknow what that's for."
Oh yeah, nobody knows. And we're not supposed to ask."
Well, whaddya think?'
Very clean! It looks great! Terrific!'
...Oh! I-I see you moved the green ottoman.'
Uh-oh...'
How-how did that happen?'
I dunno.. I-I thought it looked better there. And I- and also, it's an\nextra seat around the coffee table."

Yeah, yeah, it's interesting.. but y'know what? Just for fun, let's see\nwhat it looked like in the old spot. (She moves it.) Alright, just to compare. Let's see.\nWell, it looks good there too. Let's just leave it there for a while."
(to Rachel) I can't believe you tried to move the green ottoman."
Thank God you didn't try to fan out the magazines. I mean, she'll\nscratch your eyes right out."
You guys, I am not that bad!'
Yeah, you are, Monica. Remember when I lived with you? You were like, a\nlittle, y'know, (psycho) Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!"
That is so unfair!'
Oh c'mon! When we were kids, yours was the only Raggedy Ann doll that\nwasn't raggedy!"
Okay, so I'm responsible, I'm organised. But hey, I can be a kook."
Alright, you madcap gal. Try to imagine this. The phone bill arrives, but\nyou don't pay it right away."
Why not?'
Because you're a kook! Instead you wait until they send you a notice."
I could do that.'
Okay, uh, you let me go grocery shopping, and I buy laundry detergent,\nbut it's not the one with the easy-pour spout."
Why would someone do that?! ...One might wonder.'

Someone's left a glass on the coffee table. There's no coaster. It's a\ncold drink, it's a hot day. Little beads of condensation are inching their way closer and\ncloser to the surface of the wood..."
STOP IT!! ...Oh my God. It's true! Who am I?"
Monica? You're Mom."
Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!'

(on phone) Uh huh.. uh huh... oh my God! Okay! Okay, I'll be there! (He\nhangs up and to all.) That was my agent. (He tosses and catches the phone.) My agent has\njust gotten me a job...in the new Al Pacino movie!"
Oh my God! Whoah!'
Well, what's the part?"
Can you believe this? Al Pacino! This guy\'s the reason I became an actor!\n"I\'m out of order? Pfeeeh. You\'re out of order! This whole courtroom\'s out of\norder!"'
Seriously, what-what's the part?"
"Just when I thought I was out, they pull me back in!"'
C'mon, seriously, Joey, what's the part?"
...I'm his (mumbles)"
..You're, you're 'mah mah mah' what?"
...I'm his butt double. 'Kay? I play Al Pacino's butt. Alright? He goes\ninto the shower, and then- I'm his butt."
(trying not to laugh) Oh my God.'
C'mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino's in it, and that's\nbig!"
Oh no, it's terrific, it's... it's... y'know, you deserve this, after\nall your years of struggling, you've finally been able to crack your way into\nshowbusiness."
Okay, okay, fine! Make jokes, I don't care! This is a big break for me!"
You're right, you're right, it is...So you gonna invite us all to the big\nopening?"
Alright, alright, alright... '
Here. I need to borrow some moisturizer.'
For what?'
Whaddya think? Today's the big day!"
Oh my God. Okay, go into the bathroom, use whatever you want, just don't\never tell me what you did in there."
Thank you! (He goes into the bathroom.)'
Where's Joey? His mom's on the phone."
He's in the bathroom. I don't think you wanna go in there!"
C'mon, we're roommates! (He goes into the bathroom, screams, and runs\nback out.) My eyes!! My eyes!!"
I warned you...'
Who is being loud?'
Oh, that would be Monica. Hey, listen, I wanna borrow a coupla things,\nAurora spent the night, I really wanna make her breakfast.'
Oh, you got the whole night, huh?'
Yeah, well, I only have twenty minutes until Ethan, so, y'know.. (He\nstarts to raid the fridge.)"
Ooh, do I sense a little bit of resentment?'

No, no resentment, believe me, it's worth it. 'Kay? Y'know in a
relationship you have these key moments that you know you'll remember for the rest of your
life? Well, every- single- second is like that with Aurora.. and I've just wasted about
thirty-five of them talking to you people, so, uh.. Monica, can you help me with the door?
(He has armloads of stuff.)"
Sure. Oh, um, Chandler? Y'know, the-the old Monica would-would remind\nyou to scrub that Teflon pan with a plastic brush...But I'm not gonna do that. "
(on phone)...Dammit, hire the girl! (He hangs up the phone.)\nOkay, everybody ready?'
Uh, listen, I just wanna thank you for this great opportunity.'
Lose the robe.'
Me?'
That would work.'
Right. Okay. Losing the robe. (He takes off the robe.) And the robe is\nlost.'
Okay, everybody, we'd like to get this in one take, please. Let's roll\nit.. water's working (The shower starts).. and... action."
And cut. Hey, Butt Guy, what the hell are you doing?'
Well, I'm- I'm showering."
No, that was clenching.'
Oh. Well, the way I see it, the guy's upset here, y'know? I mean, his\nwife's dead, his brother's missing... I think his butt would be angry here."
I think his butt would like to get this shot before lunch. Once again,\nrolling... water working... and action....and cut. What was that?'
I was going for quiet desperation. But if you have to ask...'
God, I love these fingers...'
Thank you.'
No, actually I meant my fingers. Look at 'em, look at how happy they\nare."
(moves Chandler's arm and look at his watch.) Oh my God, I'm late. (She\nstarts to get up.)"
Oh no nonononononnononono, don't go.. (He kisses her and pulls her\nback down.)"
Okay.'
Don't go."
Okay. Oh no, I have to.'
(to himself) Too bad, she's leaving."
(getting up and dressing) I'm sorry. He'll be waiting for me."
Well, I thought- I thought you talked to Rick.'
It's not Rick."
What, Ethan? He got to spend the whole day with you!'
No, it's-it's Andrew. "
I know there'll be many moments in the years to come when I'll regret\nasking the following question, but- And Andrew is?"
He's... new."
Oh, so what you're saying is you're not completely fulfilled by Rick,\nEthan and myself?"
No, that's not exactly what I was.."
Well, y'know, most women would kill for three guys like us."
So what do you want?'
You.'
You have me!'
Nono, just you.'
Whaddyou mean?'
Lose the other guys.'
...Like, ...all of them?'
C'mon, we're great together, why not?"
Why can't we just have what we have now? Why can't we just talk, and\nlaugh, and make love, without feeling obligated to one another... and up until tonight I\nthought that's what you wanted too."

...Well, y'know, part of me wants that, but it's like I'm two guys,
y'know? I mean, one guy's going 'Shut up! This is great!' But there's this other guy.
Actually it's the same guy that wells up every time that Grinch's heart grows three sizes
and breaks that measuring device... And he's saying, y'know, 'This is too hard! Get out!
Get out!'"
So... which one of the two guys will you listen to?'
I don't know, I-I have to listen to both of them, they don't exactly\nlet each other finish..."
Which one?'
...The second guy.'
(gets up to leave) Well, call me if you change your mind.'
Sorry, the first guy runs the lips.'
Look at it this way
Hey!'
Hey, waitwait, aren't you the guy that plays the butt in the new Al\nPacino movie?"
Nope.'
No? What happened, big guy?'
(to Ross) "Big guy?"'
It felt like a 'big guy' moment."
I got fired.'
Oh!'
Yeah, they said I acted too much with it. I told everybody about this! Now\neverybody's gonna go to the theatre, expecting to see me, and..."
Oh, Joey, you know what, no-one is gonna be able to tell.'
My mom will.'
Something so sweet and...disturbing about that.'
Y'know, I've done nothing but crappy plays for six years. And I finally\nget my shot, and I blow it!"
Maybe this wasn't your shot."
Yeah, I mean... I think when it's your shot, y'know, you-you know it's\nyour shot. Did it... feel like your shot..?"
Hard to tell, I was naked.'

No, I don't think this was your shot. I mean, I don't even think you
just get one shot. I really believe big things are gonna happen for you, I do! You've
gotta just keep thinking about the day that some kid is gonna run up to his friends and go
'I got the part! I got the part! I'm gonna be Joey Tribbiani's ass!'."
Yeah? That's so nice! (They hug.)"
I'm sorry, Joey. I'm gonna go to bed, guys. "
Night.'
Uh, Mon, you-you gonna leave your shoes out here?'
(determined) Uh-huh!'
Really? Just casually strewn about in that reckless haphazard manner?'
Doesn't matter, I'll get 'em tomorrow. Or not. Whenever. (He goes to her\nroom.)"
She is a kook.'

(hums for a while, then gives up, and in her head) If it bothers you
that much, just go out and get the shoes. No. Don't do this. This is stupid! I don't have
to prove anything, I'm gonna go get them...But then everyone will know. Unless I get them,
and then wake up really early and put them back! ...I need help! (She buries her head
in her pillow.) "
